data.title: What can I eat tonight ?
data.statement: Given [[N]] available foods (ingredients) and [[P]] recipes with their required ingredients, find all recipes that can be cooked.

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read availableFood:string(256)
read P:int
loop P read recipe:string(256)
write recipes
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of foods you have.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string for the name of a food you have.
<<Next line:>> An integer [[P]] for the number of recipes you know.
<<Next [[P]] lines:>> Comma-separated strings, where the first string is the recipe name and the subsequent strings are the names of the ingredients required to cook the recipe.
data.outputDescription: The names of all cookable recipes, each on a new line, in the same order they were provided in the input. If no recipes can be cooked, output {{FASTFOOD JOKER}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given N available foods (ingredients) and P recipes with their required ingredients, find all recipes that can be cooked.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of foods you have.
Next N lines: A string for the name of a food you have.
Next line: An integer P for the number of recipes you know.
Next P lines: Comma-separated strings, where the first string is the recipe name and the subsequent strings are the names of the ingredients required to cook the recipe.
Output
The names of all cookable recipes, each on a new line, in the same order they were provided in the input. If no recipes can be cooked, output FASTFOOD JOKER.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
1 ≤ P ≤ 100
Example
Input
4
Poulet
Vin blanc
Bouillon de poule
Moutarde
2
Poulet moutarde,Poulet,Moutarde,Vin blanc,Bouillon de poule
Risotto au chorizo,Riz,Chorizo,Bouillon de poule,Vin blanc,Poivron
Output
Poulet moutarde
